page.title: 09THE LEISURE CENTRE.
page.content: { The Leisure Centre}was started in 1979 and building was completed by March 1982. Mr. J. Robinson was the architect. Seventy people now work there, twenty-five of them being full-time and forty-five part-time. Twelve different{sporting facilities are available, many taking place in the gym known as the{Westmorland Hall. {Swimming}is the most popular and over an average Bank Holiday 2700 children and 2100 adults use the pool. The busiest time of any week is the week_ end. The pool holds 450 000 litres of water which is changed fully once every year. The Centre is also used for classical entertainment, light entertainment and parties. There are 3000 members altogether. { St. Mark's School}recently took part in the Mary Wakefield Festival, sing_ ing on stage in the{Westmorland Hall.
